column2: UTAH DRIVER'S LICENSE TEST
Question Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. Speed limit signs are:
column8: destination signs (guide signs)

column2: 2. A large vehicle is backing up to unload goods. You should:
column4: enter one of the blind spots and wait.
column6: be patient and wait until the large vehicle has completed its backup maneuver.
column8: try to pass close behind.

column2: 3. This sign means:
column4: Take route 45 if you are driving at night.
column6: The night-time speed limit is 45 MPH.
column8: The minimum speed limit is 45 MPH.
column10: The recommended speed limit is 45 MPH.

column2: 4. On slippery roads, drivers should:
column4: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.
column6: leave more space in front of their vehicle.
column8: reduce the reaction distance.

column2: 5. Which of the following may result in an arrest for driving under the influence of intoxicants (DUII)?
column4: An inhalant, such as glue or paint.
column8: A controlled substance, such as prescription medicines or illegal drugs.

column2: 6. You are approaching an intersection with a yellow flashing light. You should:
column4: prepare to stop; the light is about to turn red.
column6: speed up to beat the red light.
column8: stop and wait for the light to change.
column10: proceed with caution through the intersection.

column2: 7. When you approach a railroad crossing, but you do not see a train. You must stop:
column4: if the crossing lights are flashing.
column6: if a stop sign is posted.
column8: if a crossing gate is lowered.

column2: 8. With conventional brakes, the correct way to stop in an emergency situation where traction is lost and the car slides is by pumping the brakes.
9. A four-way stop sign means:
column4: if two vehicles reach the intersection at the same time, the driver on the left yields to the driver on the right.
column6: there are four stop signs at this intersection.
column8: traffic from all four directions must stop.

column2: 10. If another car has stopped in an adjacent lane in the same direction of travel, you should:
column4: be careful in case the other vehicle has stopped for a pedestrian.
column6: speed up and pass the vehicle on the right.
column8: pass the car on the left.
column10: tap your horn to let the other driver know you are passing.

column2: 11. If your vehicle starts to hydroplane you should:
column4: maintain your current speed to gain better traction.
column6: apply the brakes firmly to prevent your vehicle from sliding.
column8: slow down gradually and do not apply the brakes.

column2: 12. This road sign means:
column8: School zone ahead

column2: 13. To drive defensively, you must:
column6: keep one hand on the steering wheel.
column8: use the vehicle ahead as your only points of focus.

column2: 14. This regulatory sign tells drivers that:
column4: traffic in the right lane must go straight.
column6: traffic in the left lane must turn left at the intersection ahead.
column8: all vehicles must turn left immediately.

column2: 15. If you remain in the back blind spot of a large vehicle:
column6: the large vehicle will take much longer to stop.
column8: you increase the chance of a crash.

column2: 16. You reach an intersection that is not controlled at the same time as a driver on your right, and both of you prepare to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
column8: No one.

column2: 17. This road sign means:
column8: Sharp curves ahead

column2: 18. When two cars arrive at an intersection with no signs or signals at the same time, which car has the right-of-way?
column4: The car that is traveling faster.
column6: The car in which the driver sounds the horn.
column8: The car approaching from the right.
column10: The car approaching from the left.

column2: 19. If your car starts to skid, turn your steering wheel:
column4: to keep the front wheels straight.
column6: in any direction. It doesnt matter.
column8: in the direction you want to go.
column10: in the opposite direction of the skid.

column2: 20. When the driver behind you wants to pass, you should:
column8: slow down to allow room for the other driver to complete the pass safely.

column2: 21. ABS is the acronym for:
column8: Anti-Locking Brake System

column2: 22. Drivers may pass on a two-lane roadway marked with a single solid yellow line on their side of the center line.
23. If a vehicle using high beams comes toward you, look towards __________ of the road.
column8: the center

column2: 24. The picture shows:
column8: a reversible road sign.

column2: 25. This sign warns drivers of:
column8: a narrow bridge ahead.
column10: a low place in the road.
